      • getApplicationCacheDir

        public static java.io.File getApplicationCacheDir(android.content.Context context)
        For application private storage, Appboy uses the cache dir. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/data-storage.html#filesInternal
        Parameters:
        context -
        Returns:
        a file pointing to the appropriate application storage directory.

      • getExternalStorage

        public static java.io.File getExternalStorage(java.lang.String folderName)
        http://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/Environment.html#getExternalStorageDirectory()
        Parameters:
        folderName - specified folder name
        Returns:
        a file pointing to the specified folder in primary external storage directory.

      • deleteFileOrDirectory

        public static void deleteFileOrDirectory(java.io.File fileOrDirectory)
        Recursively deletes all the files under a directory. If the input file is not a directory, then this only deletes the file. This is recursive since directories must be empty before deletion.
        Parameters:
        fileOrDirectory - a file or directory to be deleted.

      • isRemoteUri

        public static boolean isRemoteUri(android.net.Uri uri)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        whether the given uri is a remote uri

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getMimeType

        public static java.lang.String getMimeType(java.lang.String remoteUrl)
        Parameters:
        remoteUrl - an internet url
        Returns:
        a best guess MIME type inferred from the url

      • downloadFileToPath

        public static java.io.File downloadFileToPath(java.lang.String downloadDirectoryAbsolutePath,
                              java.lang.String remoteFileUrl,
                              java.lang.String outputFilename,
                              java.lang.String extension)
        Parameters:
        downloadDirectoryAbsolutePath - the absolute file path to the download directory. Must begin with "/".
        remoteFileUrl - the remote url of the file to be downloaded
        outputFilename - filename of the end result file with no file extension
        extension - file extension (optional)
        Returns:
        the downloaded zip file. If then file could not be downloaded, then returns null
